title: Square coil moves through magnetic field

content.question: A square coil with sides of length 1.0 cm is moved through a region of uniform magnetic field at a constant speed, as shown in the figure above. Which of the following graphs best shows the current I in the coil as a function of the position x of the right edge as the coil moves through the magnetic field, where counterclockwise current is positive?

choices.label: The figure presents a graph in quadrants 1 and 4 of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled “x, in centimeters,” and the numbers 1 and 3 are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “I, in amperes,” and no numbers are indicated along the axis. The graph consists of four connected straight line segments. The first line segment begins at a point below the origin on the vertical axis, and extends upward and to the right until it reaches 1 on the x axis. The second line segment extends horizontally along the x axis, until it reaches 3. The third line segment extends vertically upward by the same distance as the graph began below the origin. The fourth line segment extends downward and to the right until it ends at 4 on the x axis.

The figure presents a graph in quadrants 1 and 4 of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled “x, in centimeters,” and the numbers 1 and 3 are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “I, in amperes,” and no numbers are indicated along the axis. The graph consists of six connected straight line segments. The first line segment begins at a point below the origin on the vertical axis, and extends horizontally to the right 1 unit. The second line segment extends vertically upward until it reaches 1 on the x axis. The third line segment extends horizontally along the x axis, until it reaches 3. The fourth line segment extends vertically upward by the same distance as the graph began below the origin. The fifth line segment extends horizontally to the right until it ends at a point that is 4 units to the right of the vertical axis and the same distance above the x axis as the graph started below the origin. The sixth line segment extends vertically downward until it reaches 4 on the x axis.

The figure presents a graph in quadrants 1 and 4 of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled “x, in centimeters,” and the numbers 1 and 3 are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “I, in amperes,” and no numbers are indicated along the axis. The graph consists of four connected straight line segments. The first line segment begins at a point above the origin on the vertical axis, and extends downward and to the right until it reaches 1 on the x axis. The second line segment extends horizontally along the x axis, until it reaches 3. The third line segment extends vertically downward by the same distance as the graph began above the origin. The fourth line segment extends upward and to the right until it ends at 4 on the x axis.

The figure presents a graph in quadrants 1 and 4 of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled “x, in centimeters,” and the numbers 1 and 3 are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “I, in amperes,” and no numbers are indicated along the axis. The graph consists of six connected straight line segments. The first line segment begins at a point above the origin on the vertical axis, and extends horizontally to the right 1 unit. The second line segment extends  vertically downward until it reaches 1 on the x axis. The third line segment extends horizontally along the x axis, until it reaches 3. The fourth line segment extends vertically downward by the same distance as the graph began below the origin. The fifth line segment extends horizontally to the right until it ends at a point that is 4 units to the right of the vertical axis and the same distance below the x axis as the graph started below the origin. The sixth line segment extends vertically upward until it reaches 4 on the x axis.

The figure presents a graph in quadrants 1 and 4 of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled “x, in centimeters,” and the numbers 1 and 3 are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “I, in amperes,” and no numbers are indicated along the axis. The graph consists of two connected straight  line segments. The first line segment begins at a point below the origin on the vertical axis, and extends upward and to the right. It crosses the x axis at 2, and continues upward until it reaches a point that is 4 units to the right of the vertical axis and the same distance above the x axis as the graph started below the origin. The second line segment extends vertically downward until it ends at 4 on the x axis.

content.answer: The figure presents a graph in quadrants 1 and 4 of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled “x, in centimeters,” and the numbers 1 and 3 are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “I, in amperes,” and no numbers are indicated along the axis. The graph consists of six connected straight line segments. The first line segment begins at a point below the origin on the vertical axis, and extends horizontally to the right 1 unit. The second line segment extends vertically upward until it reaches 1 on the x axis. The third line segment extends horizontally along the x axis, until it reaches 3. The fourth line segment extends vertically upward by the same distance as the graph began below the origin. The fifth line segment extends horizontally to the right until it ends at a point that is 4 units to the right of the vertical axis and the same distance above the x axis as the graph started below the origin. The sixth line segment extends vertically downward until it reaches 4 on the x axis.
